nodes.text: Hokk was a male member of the Disciples of Ragnos, a cult that wanted to revive the Sith Lord Marka Ragnos, who had died in 5000 BBY. In 14 ABY, Hokk, along with others such as J'aahn, took part in an attempt to disable a cargo train in bustling Coronet City, capital of the planet Corellia. Jedi Padawan Jaden Korr and Jedi Master Kyle Katarn, who were in Coronet City to investigate reports of Disciples of Ragnos activity, heard a distress call from the cargo train. Korr quickly made his way over; when the Padawan arrived, Hokk was going to meet J'aahn at Station Six-C, but Korr stopped the cultists before he could.
Hokk's voice was briefly heard in the Raven Software video game Star Wars: Jedi Knight: Jedi Academy, first released on September 16, 2003.
